speaker: Roz
text: So when's Freddie comin' in?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, actually, he's arriving in a few hours, I'm picking him up at the airport.  Gosh, you know, I'm so excited to see him. It was Lilith's turn to have him for his birthday this year, but apparently there was an accident at the lab.  One of her monkeys bit her on the tongue.

speaker: Roz
text: [_disturbed_] What exactly was she doing with the monkey?

speaker: Frasier
text: She was teaching them sign language.  I guess one of them made a disparaging remark about her new haircut, she stuck her tongue out.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow!  How bad does a haircut have to be for a monkey to hate it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Well, I guess I'm just gonna have to get myself a cup of coffee. [_He notices something._] Oh, somebody dropped a wallet.

speaker: Roz
text: Hmmm.  Is he cute?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to tell from a driver's license photo, but he is five foot six, weighs two hundred pounds and has corrective lenses.

speaker: Roz
text: Leave it on the floor!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank God I don't share your "Good deeds for hunks only" policy. [_to counterman_] Excuse me, I just found this...

speaker: Man
text: Hey, hey, is that my wallet you got there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it?  I just found it on the floor over there, I was just about to leave it at the counter.  Please, no reward.

speaker: Man
text: What happened to my cash?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know.  It was empty when I found it.

speaker: Man
text: Yeah, right!  I had seven bucks in here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I'm sure some lucky thief is off enjoying a matinee and a small soda!

speaker: Man
text: At least you left my credit card!  Jerk! [_He stalks off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you please bring me my usual? [_He returns to the table._] Do you believe that guy?  I do him a favor, he accuses me of stealing!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please.  The world is full of creeps like that. Haven't you figured that out yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Roz, but I still believe people are basically good.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, guys, I'm glad you're here.  I need to talk to you about something.

speaker: Frasier
text: What can I do for you, Bulldog?

speaker: Bulldog
text: My mom's having bypass surgery tomorrow morning, and I'd like to sit up with her tonight at the hospital.  But I gotta work the eleven-to-one spot.  I don't suppose you could...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, right!  Like we don't know there's a big fight in Vegas tonight!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Look, I know I've jerked you guys around before, but this is serious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, I'm sorry, Frederick's coming in tonight, it's his birthday.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_taking out a cell phone and dialing_] OK, Doc.  Never mind, I understand.  Hello, Bernice Briscoe's room, please.  I hope my mom's around to celebrate her next birthday.  Hi, Mom. It's Bobby.  Um, look, I'm gonna have to work tonight after all...

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, wait a minute.  You know what?  Frederick will probably be asleep by eleven, I guess we could take your spot...

speaker: Roz
text: Are you insane?!  How can you be so gullible?  He is not talking to his mother!

speaker: Roz
text: Does somebody have a boo-boo on her heart?  Is someone gonna have to open you up with those big old rib spreaders? [_then_] Oh, Mrs. Briscoe, I'm so sorry.  Listen, I just wanted you to know that we'll fill in for Bobby tonight.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Thanks a million, you guys.  I better get back to the hospital.

speaker: Frasier
text: God bless, Bulldog.

speaker: Roz
text: [_her face in her hands_] I can't believe I said that! Oh, that poor woman...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, we're outta here!

speaker: Woman
text: But our flight doesn't leave for another two hours.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, I gotta stop by my mom's first.  I owe her fifty bucks and a case of Schlitz.  _They leave, FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment. Fade in.  Niles is sitting at the dining table.  He is dipping balloons into a glass of water, blotting them on a napkin, then twirling them in the air to dry.  Martin comes in and sees this._

speaker: Martin
text: Should I even ask?

speaker: Niles
text: These balloons come in an unsealed package, covered in some mysterious dust, straight from some southeast Asian sweatshop. Doesn't that worry you?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting_] Oh, you bet it does.  I remember back in Korea, we'd crouch in our foxholes, scared to death those bastards were gonna drop balloons on us.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rushing in from her room_] The doorman just called. They're on their way up.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know how much of a surprise it's going to be, anyway. You did the same thing last year.

speaker: Martin
text: That's the whole point.  He's never gonna suspect I'd do it two years in a row.

speaker: Daphne
text: I must say, I feel a bit bad for Freddie.  None of his mates are going to be here, just us three old fogeys yelling "Surprise".

speaker: Martin
text: Well, any party he's at with you is gonna be a treat for him. You know, he's got that little crush on you.

speaker: Niles
text: If you really want Frederick to enjoy himself, he especially likes you in that little blue cocktail dress.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm not sure that dress is appropriate for a child's birthday party.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's hardly a party, it's just us fogeys.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Frederick, your granddad really wanted to be here, but he had an important Rotary Club meeting.

speaker: Freddie
text: Uh-oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Freddie
text: Not another surprise party.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Freddie
text: Just like last year!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord, all right, all right.  I'll tell you what, just don't let on, OK?  You know how he loves this stuff.  Just act surprised, all right?

speaker: Freddie
text: The hardest part is pretending to be fooled by those trick candles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh.  You think it's hard now, wait 'til you're my age.

speaker: All
text: Surprise!

speaker: Freddie
text: Oh, wow!  I'm so surprised!

speaker: Martin
text: See, I told you! _Martin and Niles come towards him with arms outstretched saying "Happy birthday", Freddie walks past them and races into Daphne's arms for a big hug._

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi!

speaker: Daphne
text: Happy birthday, sweetheart.  Just let me get the phone. [_She answers as Freddie trails after like a puppy._] Hello? Yes, who's calling please?  Wiwif?  Anybody here know a Wiwif?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lilith! [_He takes the phone._] Yes, hello Lilith. What's that?  Oh, right!  Yes, of course he's here. It's your mom, Freddie, why don't you take it into your granddad's room? [_He hands it to Freddie._]

speaker: Freddie
text: OK.  Hi, mom. [_He goes off._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, let's get the cake ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes.  Oh, Frasier, I think you're going to be pleasantly surprised.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooooh. _The men go to the kitchen.  There is a large cake on the stove, a three-dimensional portrait of a man's face, which despite the festive coloring, is more than a little creepy._

speaker: Niles
text: Et, voila!

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is that?

speaker: Niles
text: It's Louis Pasteur, Freddie's favorite scientist.

speaker: Frasier
text: What child wouldn't be thrilled with a coconut death mask on his birthday?

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, what happened to your jacket?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, at the airport, I helped this woman get a dog into her car.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I hope at least it was in a crate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, a very heavy crate.  I had to hold it at arm's length so that what I chose to believe was drool wouldn't run out onto my shoes. [_Niles grimaces._] Eight blocks later, I finally load little Fido into her backseat, the woman drives off without so much as a "Thank you" or an offer to give me a ride back to the airport.  Well, I responded with the time-honored gesture of disapproval, but on the upswing I caught my finger on the jacket and, well... I must say, my belief in people's basic decency has taken a beating today.  You know, earlier I returned a man's wallet, he accused me of stealing.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it just proves what I always say: A good Samaritan is nothin' but a good target.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Dad.  I'm not ready to be quite that cynical yet.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming in, excited_] He's off the phone!

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh, good.  All right.  Well, you can believe what you want, but I think people are born rotten, and every year they get worse. [_He leads the procession out of the kitchen._] Happy birthday to you...  _FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - The Radio Station. Frasier is on the air, Roz is yawning on her side._

speaker: Frasier
text: Welcome back to the night owl edition of the Dr. Frasier Crane show.  We have Stephen on line two.  Go ahead, caller, you're on the air.

speaker: Stephen
text: [_v.o._] I think I'm losing my mind, Dr. Crane.  People are talking to me through my radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why do you think that?

speaker: Stephen
text: There it is again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Turn your radio down.

speaker: Stephen
text: Now it's giving me orders!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stephen, turn your radio down.

speaker: Stephen
text: And it knows my name!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stephen, listen to me: this is your radio talking.  I'm a very smart radio, and I care about you.  And I want you to turn me off, go to bed, and seek counseling in the morning.

speaker: Stephen
text: OK.  Sorry, Doc, can't talk anymore. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd like to end tonight on a philosophical note. You see, earlier today, I helped some people. [_Roz uses a butterfly clip to hold her bangs up and begins wiping off her makeup with pads._] I returned a man's wallet and I aided a woman at the airport.  And in return, I was accused of being a thief, and my favorite jacket was ruined.  I was so disappointed by the events of the day that, on my way to work here tonight, I almost passed by an elderly man with a flat tire without stopping to help him.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell are you doing? [_remembering_] ...I asked myself. How would I feel if I were in this man's position, and no one stopped to help me?  Well, I did pull over, I helped the man, and frankly it felt great.  So without sounding preachy, I would like to advise you all to do a good deed once in a while.  If not for the sake of others, but then for your own sake.  Now let's go to station ID. [_off-air_] Roz, do you mind?

speaker: Roz
text: What is your problem?  I'm getting ready for bed.  Alice gets me up at the crack of dawn, if I get all this taken care of, I get an extra half hour's sleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least you spared me the spectacle of flossing!

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for reminding me.  I had corn.

speaker: Frasier
text: And we're back.  It seems we've got time for one more call... [_Roz is now flossing and can't help._] Don't bother Roz, I'll get it.  Go ahead, caller, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, I'm listening.

speaker: Ralph
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane.  This is Ralph.  The guy whose tire you changed tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ralph!  Well, what a wonderful surprise.  Let me first say to our listeners that this call was not solicited in any way.

speaker: Ralph
text: Dr. Crane, I was just wondering, do you wear cuff links?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why yes, as a matter of fact, I do.  But there's no need to buy me a gift.

speaker: Ralph
text: A gift?!  You scratched the hell out of my paint job with those things!  You owe me money!

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't be serious!  How much damage can cuff links do to a car whose side window consists of duct tape and a Hefty Bag?

speaker: Ralph
text: Ah, you'll find out when my lawyer sends you the bill!

speaker: Roz
text: Let me remind you again, listeners, that call was not solicited.   **MR. GOOD DEEDS GOES TO TOWN**  _Scene 4 - The Street Fade in.  It is raining as Frasier drives home.  As he pulls to a stop, there is a woman, shielding her head with a purse, waving at him._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinking, v.o._] Oh, great!  Somebody else in need of a good Samaritan.  Maybe if I ignore her, she'll stop waving.  But what am I gonnna do?  Just leave her standing in the rain? Then again, every one of my good deeds today has ended up biting me in the butt. _Frasier pulls to the curb, rolls down his window, and calls to the woman._

speaker: Frasier
text: Such nasty weather, may I offer you a ride?

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Crystal
text: I didn't think anyone was going to stop tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, chivalry may be on life support, but it's not dead.

speaker: Crystal
text: Ooh, seat warmers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they're standard.  There's a little control on the side if you want more leg room.  So, where can I take you?

speaker: Crystal
text: It's up to you.  We can get a room, or we can do it here, in the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in shock_] Oh, dear God.  You are a prostitute.

speaker: Crystal
text: How far do these go back?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I'm sorry, there's been a mistake.

speaker: Crystal
text: Don't be nervous, baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not nervous and would you please put your seat up.

speaker: Crystal
text: I'll put it any way you want me to, honey.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling over_] Stop talking to me that way!  For God's sake! All right, please, I am sorry about the misunderstanding but get out of my car.

speaker: Crystal
text: Well, why the hell did you pick me up?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was trying to be a gentleman, now get out!

speaker: Crystal
text: I'm not walking all the way back to my corner, give me some money for a cab.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_checking his pockets_] All right, fine.  Oh lord, I guess I must have left my wallet back at the station.

speaker: Crystal
text: Well, how in the hell were you going to pay for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: I wasn't going to pay for you!  Oh, good lord.  Oh, here's a twenty dollar bill, now get out.  _Suddenly there are flashing lights and a quick burst of a siren behind them._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, get out!  Hurry, out, out!

speaker: Crystal
text: It's too late, they've seen us.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe this is happening to me. [_He rolls down his window._] Hello officer, just how fast was I going?

speaker: Cop
text: Hey, don't I know you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't believe so.

speaker: Cop
text: No, I'm not talking to you.  Didn't I bust you last week?

speaker: Crystal
text: [_voice now an octave lower and obviously a man_] Give me a break, buddy.  I'm trying to earn a living here.  _Frasier is wide-eyed in shock.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - The Police Station. Fade in.  Frasier is being led to the waiting area._

speaker: Frasier
text: Was it really necessary to take my belt and tie?

speaker: Cop
text: Standard procedure.  It's for your own protection.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake!  You had me in the drunk tank.  If I wanted to kill myself I would've taken a deep breath.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You certainly took your sweet time.  I've been waiting here two hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Niles.  I guess what with the pillow fight in the holding tank and the pre-mug shot makeover, time just got away from me.  Will you stop it?!  Just bail me out of here, I can't stand another minute in this place!

speaker: Niles
text: All right. [_to the desk sergeant, Fred_] Excuse me, if you could get our bill together, we're ready to settle up here.

speaker: Fred
text: It's five hundred bucks.

speaker: Niles
text: Five hun... Frasier, I don't have that kind of cash on me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Put it on your credit card!

speaker: Niles
text: And have "Bail" appear on my statement?  Do you know the kind of junk mail I would get?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just do it!

speaker: Niles
text: OK.  There you are. [_He gives his card to Fred, then turns back to Frasier_] So, what happened?  A prostitute? [_snickers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, I told you on the phone.  I didn't know she was a prostitute.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Frasier
text: I saw a woman stranded in the rain, naturally I offered her a ride.  Before I knew it, I was handcuffed to this bench surrounded by this motley assortment of... [_noticing them watching him_] ...other wrongfully accused gentlemen.

speaker: Fred
text: Sir, your card didn't go through.

speaker: Niles
text: What?  Oh, that's right.  Maris's lawyers had my credit limit reduced.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Niles
text: It's been so bad, this week when I went to the cheese shop for their "Around the World" platter, they cut me off at Luxembourg.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you please call Dad and get him down here?

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting on his cell phone_] All right.  Yeah, Dad? Hi, my  credit card was declined.  Well, we need yours. Yeah.  Well, right.  Yeah, I'll see you soon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, this is intolerable.  Now it'll take him twenty minutes to get here.

speaker: Niles
text: No, he's waiting in the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Why didn't he come in?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, this was his old precinct.  When we pulled up outside, I saw a look on his face I haven't seen since he drove us home from our first and only little league game.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Shhh.  Hold it down, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm so sorry.  What happened was...

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't need to know.  I didn't come down here to judge. You're my son, and I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, for God's sake, Dad, I didn't...

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't we just pay up and get out of here, OK?

speaker: Fred
text: Hey, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fred.

speaker: Fred
text: Listen, I wouldn't take this too hard, Marty.  You remember Captain Pachesky's son turned out to be the Coleman Park Pervert.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, thanks.

speaker: Fred
text: And Sergeant O'Brian's daughter does all them cable movies.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I heard.

speaker: Fred
text: You can pick her out, she's got his chin.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, could we just get on with it here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, would you let me explain?

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, look, I understand, I was in the army.  We all have our urges.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but you don't...

speaker: Fred
text: Just sign here.

speaker: Frasier
text: All that happened was...

speaker: Crystal
text: Bye, Dr. Crane, sorry I got you arrested.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, Crystal, these things happen.

speaker: Frasier
text: He had a wig on!

speaker: Martin
text: You're my son and I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, will you stop saying that?!  _They head out.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment. The hallway outside.  The elevator opens and the men step out._

speaker: Martin
text: I still don't know what you were thinking.  Middle of the night, deserted street, picking up a strange woman.

speaker: Niles
text: [_snickering again_] A VERY strange woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Obviously I wasn't thinking.  Thank God it's all over. I'll just spend a quiet weekend here with Frederick. [_He picks the paper off the floor._] Oh, dear God!

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading_] "Doc's Pal Is a Mock Gal"

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, will this nightmare never end?!  Now, listen Dad, we're bound to get a lot of calls about this thing.  Please do not answer the phone, don't talk to anybody, just let the machine get it.  You don't want to give them anything they can turn into something tawdry...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I live with Dr. Crane.  Yeah, there's quite a bit of massage involved.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mostly around the hips, thighs and buttocks.

speaker: Frasier
text: God!  Give me that! [_grabbing the phone_] No comment! [_He hangs up._] Oh, Daphne, please don't answer the phone, let the machine pick up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well the machine's filled up.  Everyone's been calling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, where's Frederick?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's still asleep.  Look, Dr. Crane, I just wanted to say you're the victim here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, American society's so close-minded when it comes to sexual experimentation.  In Europe...

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I didn't do anything wrong!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, exactly!  That's what I'm trying to say!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I guess I deserve all this.  I certainly had enough warning to stop being such a Boy Scout, but did I listen?  No.  Well, from now on, Dr. Crane -- [_off the paper_] or as Seattle now knows him, "Dr. Strangelove" - is out of the Samaritan business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, have you given much thought about what you're going to tell Frederick?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.  How can I possibly explain it to him?  Well, I guess the key is not to be evasive.  He's going to hear about it sooner or later, I guess it should be from me.

speaker: Frasier
text: After all, I am a trained professional, I can do it in a way that won't traumatize the child. [_seeing Freddie reach for the paper, he bellows_] FREDDIE, DON'T TOUCH THAT!

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] You know, I could use a glass of orange juice. I think I'm gonna go in the kitchen get a glass.

speaker: Niles
text: [_also rising_] Oh, orange juice, yum.  I'm going to come with you for that.

speaker: Freddie
text: Am I having another surprise party?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] No, no, Frederick.  Here, sit down for a second, son. [_They both sit at the table._] I, I've got something I've gotta talk to you about.  For the next couple of days, you're going to hear some rather nasty stories and some snide jokes about your old man...

speaker: Freddie
text: Mom's coming?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no she's not.  It's very hard for me to tell you this, but I just spent the night in jail.

speaker: Freddie
text: Wow!  Like Brad Johnson's dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was different.  Insider trading is wrong.

speaker: Freddie
text: What did you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I saw a woman standing in the rain and I gave her a ride.

speaker: Freddie
text: You can go to jail for that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it depends on the sort of woman.  You see, this particular woman, this uh, person was a prostitute. But I didn't know that until it was too late.

speaker: Freddie
text: A prostitute?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, how can I explain this?   A prostitute is someone who engages in sexual relations with other people for money.

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad, I'm eleven.  I know what a prostitute is.  But, why did you pick one up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you see, I didn't know that it was a prostitute at the time.  I was only trying to do a good deed.  Well, I suppose in hindsight it was all a big mistake.  I should have minded my own business.

speaker: Freddie
text: So what are you trying to say, Dad?  You shouldn't try to help people?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... _SMASH CUT TO:  Frasier sitting in his car in the rain.  This has all been in his head. He pulls over to the curb and rolls down his window._

speaker: Frasier
text: May I offer you a ride?

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Laura
text: I waved at you a couple of times, but I didn't think you saw me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I noticed you, I was just having sort of a bad daydream.  So, where can I take you?

speaker: Laura
text: Same place you're going.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_panicked_] Oh, dear God.  You're...

speaker: Laura
text: Laura Hilton.  I live in your building.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Laura.  Hi.

speaker: Laura
text: I'm so glad you stopped when you did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm certainly glad I stopped too.
